title: and Welfare Act 2013 (S.I. No. 15 of 2013), hereby make the following
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the Bovine Viral Diarrhoea
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the Bovine Viral Diarrhoea 
(Amendment) Regulations 2020 and come into operation on 22 May
text_norm: 1 regulation may cited bovine viral diarrhoea (amendment) regulation 2020 come operation 22 may

title: and Welfare Act 2013 (S.I. No. 15 of 2013), hereby make the following
and Welfare Act 2013 (S.I. No. 15 of 2013), hereby make the following
heading: 2. The Bovine Viral Diarrhoea Regulations 2017 are amended –
text_raw:
2. The Bovine Viral Diarrhoea Regulations 2017 are amended – 

(a) by the substitution, for Regulation 3 (2) of - 

“(2) Paragraph (1) does not apply to – 

(a) 

(b) 

a bovine from which a sample was taken under the 
Bovine Viral Diarrhoea Order 2012 or the Bovine 
Viral Diarrhoea Regulations 2014, or 

a cow from whose calf a sample was taken and 
tested for the presence of bovine viral diarrhoea 
virus before the commencement of the Bovine Viral 
Diarrhoea (Amendment) Regulations 2020.”, 

(b) 

in Regulation 9 (1) by deleting “born after 1 January 2013,”, 

(c) 

(d) 

in Regulation 9 (2) by deleting “born on or after 1 January 
2013,”, and 

In Regulation 10 (1) by deleting “a bovine born on or after 1 
January 2013, or,”. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

21 May, 2020. 

MICHAEL CREED, 

Minister for Agriculture, Food and the Marine. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 26th May, 2020. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [182] 3

title: and Welfare Act 2013 (S.I. No. 15 of 2013), hereby make the following
heading: (This note is not part of the instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation) 

The effect of these Regulations is to provide for the compulsory testing of all 
bovines born before 1 January 2013 for the presence of the bovine viral 
diarrhoea virus, with the exception of those female bovines for which a valid 
BVD virus test result is recorded for one or more offspring.
